strings.Value: "You were less polite the last time we spoke."
"So we meet again, and not on the battlefield... Assuming this tournament isn't a trap, of course."
"So Irovetti considers me a rival? I didn't think I'd given him any cause for a feud."
"This isn't the first year the tournament's been held — why was I just invited this year?"
"At least you're honest with me. I appreciate the warning."

{n}The man standing before you seems to spend a great deal of time perfecting his appearance. His cheeks and forehead are generously powdered, his hair is slicked back, and his carefully waxed mustache curls up rakishly.{/n} "Why, if it isn't {mf|King|Queen} {Name}! We meet at last. I paid a visit to your kingdom while it was still a barony, but alas, I had no chance to meet you. I'm Stefano Moskoni, confidant to King Irovetti."

{n}Since your last encounter, {d|Stefano}Stefano Moskoni{/d} has put on a little weight, and his appearance has become even more festive. As you approach, a polite smile blooms on his face.{/n} "Why, if it isn't {mf|King|Queen} {Name}! Please, allow me to congratulate you on your success!"
"How do you like our little celebration?"

"I concede my mistake — I supposed I'd met a king for a day, whose state would last a few months at best. I'd never imagined you would match my king in dignity, let alone that your country would become a worthy rival for {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}."

"Of course it's not. It may be hard to believe, but King Irovetti's intentions are quite honest this time. Trust me, he'll make a move sooner or later, but for now, he's invited you for the chance to see a new rival with his own eyes. I'll let you in on a little secret — he actually thinks very highly of you."

"I mean no offense when I say this, but both you and your state were, frankly, inconsequential, not significant enough for our attention. But your victory at {g|Brevoy}Brevoy's{/g} border and your subsequent coronation changed all that. In truth, King Irovetti only invites those he's identified as worthy rivals to the tournament."

"The unfortunate reality is that your very existence, along with the strength your kingdom has acquired, is cause enough. What would happen were you to join with {g|Mivon}Mivon{/g} against {g|Pitax}Pitax{/g}? Or perhaps you might seek to extend your lands west and not stop at the border. What if merchants from {g|Brevoy}Brevoy{/g} began traveling through your lands, bypassing Pitax entirely? And of course, the most important question..." {n}Moskoni's grin turns predatory.{/n} "Do you sit securely on your throne, or does Pitax stand a chance of expanding east?"
"Think nothing of it. I have great interest in seeing how events will unfold."
"Until we meet again — and I'm sure we will."
"Now that's real talk we have here! Come on, honorable Stefano – sing us another of your sweet political songs."
